text: Storm clouds gather above your fleet. As the rain begins to trickle down, you are filled with a sense of dread...
The storm breaks- winds billow about (ETC)
You give a valiant effort, but the storm overpowers you.
Your ships are flung about, waves crash all around you. You watch as a wall of water rises and engulfs a nearby ship, sinking it under the stormy waters...
Then, as suddenly as it had started, the sea calms. The waves relent and lead you to a nearby shore. You land the remaining ships and your people gather around you.

text: "You must be a goddess disguised... No mortal has such a face or voice."

text: You decide to follow her advice and visit the Carthaginian queen. As the young girl turns to leave, her form changes into that of a true god.
You recognize her as Venus, your mothrr. You call out to her, but she has already disappeared.
Frustrated by the trick, you walk towards the city's walls.
You walk through the city (describe) [shrouded in Venus' cloud]
As you approach the palace doors, you see Dido herself, followed by a 'large and youthful troop'.

You recognize some faces that had been whisked away by the storm. Waiting by the entrace, you hear the lost Trojans plead their case with Dido, sharing the story of their sacked city and the long voyage they'd endured.
Dido listens and tells them to calm themselves. She promises support for the Trojans, either to help send them away or build a new life in Carthage.
"I wish the storm had brought your King Aeneas himself- I will send some men to search for him."
